questions.question: How do smart contracts help ensure authenticity in a supply chain?

answers.a: By recording each batch or transaction securely on the blockchain.
answers.b: By storing physical products directly on the blockchain.
answers.c: By eliminating the need for all intermediaries in global trade.
answers.d: By controlling the physical temperature of goods during transport.

explanations.a: Correct! Smart contracts ensure authenticity by recording transactions immutably on the blockchain.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Smart contracts only store digital records, not physical goods.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Intermediaries may still exist, though processes are automated.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Smart contracts alone do not control temperature, but they can verify IoT data.

questions.question: Which of the following best explains how smart contracts improve traceability?

answers.a: They allow tracking of every stage of a transaction or product movement on the blockchain.
answers.b: They automatically reduce costs by half for all stakeholders.
answers.c: They eliminate the need for data storage in supply systems.
answers.d: They replace all forms of physical auditing processes.

explanations.a: Correct! Smart contracts enhance traceability by recording each stage in an immutable ledger.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Cost reduction is an indirect benefit, not a guaranteed feature.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Data storage is still necessary, but blockchain improves security and access.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Physical audits may still be needed, but blockchain increases trust in records.

questions.question: What role do smart contracts play in improving efficiency?

answers.a: They automate transactions and reduce manual errors by enforcing predefined rules.
answers.b: They create new physical goods in the system automatically.
answers.c: They allow only government organizations to verify transactions.
answers.d: They remove the need for any form of digital records.

explanations.a: Correct! Smart contracts improve efficiency by automating processes and reducing human error.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Smart contracts do not generate physical products.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Verification is not limited to government bodies.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Smart contracts rely on digital records stored on the blockchain.
